We thus examined the status of STAT1 activation in co-infected NHP lung tissue. Histological staining of serial sections of co-infected lungs revealed that zones rich in Siglec-1 + leukocytes also exhibited positivity for nuclear phosphorylated STAT1 (pSTAT1) ( Figure 2E), and the abundance of these two markers strongly correlated with the active status of TB in the different NHP groups ( Figure 2F). Moreover, we found that the majority of Siglec-1 + alveolar macrophages were also positive for nuclear pSTAT1 in the infected NHP groups compared to healthy ( Figure 2E and G).
